title: (x) "hippa" Bauhaus geometric sans - ITC Bauhaus {Mark S}
content:
Does anyone know what this font s called  
I have found a sinmailar font called Bauhaus 93 but the weight is to heavy.  
Thanks iin advance  
Martin

comments.content:
Blippo was my first guess as well.  
But [Pump Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20060405142405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pump-2/pump-light/) is a more likely match from the good ol’ days. (the weight of the sample is a tad bit heavier, though)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=PumpLight.png)

[ITC Bauhaus Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20060405142405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bauhaus/medium/) is a (Adobe/Linotype version) is an exact match, assuming you remove the dot on the i.

Thanks, Mark, for correcting my “senior moment.”  
Hmmmm… Blippo, Pump, ITC Bauhaus, which came first, that is, _after_ the prototype created by Herbert Bayer of the Dessau Bauhaus in 1925?

Looks like [Blippo](http://web.archive.org/web/20060405142405/http:/www.linotype.com/43306/blippo-family.html) by Fotostar in 1970 (a “Linotype Original”)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=blippo1.png)
  
then [ITC Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20060405142405/http:/www.linotype.com/570/itcbauhaus-family.html) by Ed Benguiat and Victor Caruso in 1975  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Bauhaus2.png)
  
and almost simutaneously [Pump (ITC)](http://web.archive.org/web/20060405142405/http:/www.linotype.com/90171/pump-family.html) by Phillip Kelly in late ‘75/early ‘76.  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=Pump2.png)

It’s a good thing we weren’t given only the lowercase “a, b” and “d” to ID from :-)

Thankyou all for your answers,  
cheers  
Martin
